branches.description: Student addresses Peer
Peer addresses Student
Student addresses Adult
Adult addresses Student
Student works independently on a computing related task
Student works independently on a non computing task
Student joins peer conversation

nodes.title: How does the interaction with the peer or adult begin or continue?

branches.description: Student clearly expresses how he or she needs help with a difficulty or problem
Student expresses a need for help, but is not explicit to the difficulty or problem
Student discusses computing (not problem solving)
Student engages in non-computing conversation
Student offers support to peer (the peer did not specifically ask for help)
Student said something that is unclear or inaudible

Student verbally addresses a person without expressing the offer or need for help, curiosity, excitement, accomplishment or non-computing conversation (e.g., "Hey you..." or "Mrs. S..." or "Stop that!")
Peer offers self-regulation support to student
branches.aside: Describe the support in the field notes.

branches.description: Peer offers support to student who was working collaboratively on a problem or topic
Peer offers support to student who was working independently on a problem or topic
Peer discusses computing (not problem solving)
Peer engages student in non-computing conversation (heard on student's computer)
Peer asks student for help
Peer said something that is unclear or inaudible
Peer verbally addresses the student without expressing the need/offer for help, curiosity, excitement, accomplishment or non-computing conversation (e.g. "Hey you..." or "Can you stop that!")
Adult offers self-regulation support to student
branches.aside: Describe the support in the field notes.

branches.description: Adult offers support to student who was working collaboratively on a problem or topic
Adult offers support to student who was working independently on a problem or topic
Adult talks to student about a non-computing task (e.g., student has to finish a math problem, check recording, go to another room)
Adult verbally comments on student's work [heard on student's computer]
Adult engages in non-computing conversation [heard on student's computer]
Adult said something that is unclear or inaudible
Adult verbally addresses the student without expressing the offer for help, curiosity, excitement, accomplishment or non-computing conversation (e.g., "Can you please stop that!")
Adult directs student to computing task
Student's cursor stopped moving for more than 30 seconds, or the student leaves station (> 30 seconds) and returns to independently work [end path]
Interaction terminates [end path]
The video record ends [end path]

nodes.title: What was the problem? (This is referring to the difficulty not the subtask)

branches.description: Difficulty or problem or topic is related to computing/programming
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to academic content
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to navigating software (e.g. logging in, changing levels)
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to asset creation and management (e.g. creating/modifying/resizing images, recording/editing audio)
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to general computer technology (e.g., mouse, monitor, adapter)
Difficulty or problem or topic is related to multiple of the above categories
branches.aside: Indicate the relevant categories in the field notes using the following keywords: "computing/programming", "academic content", "navigating software", "asset creation/management", "general computer technology", "other"

branches.description: Other (Please add addtional notes)

nodes.title: What did the interaction between the Peer or Adult and the student look like?

branches.description: Peer and student discuss the difficulty or problem
Peer and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and another person(s) joins the discussion
Peer recites all steps of the solution
Peer recites all steps of the solution, and another person(s) joins
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and no discussions are occurring
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, no discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and discussions are occurring
Peer physically shows by taking over the student's computer, discussions are occurring, and another person (s) joins
Peer and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and then Peer directs student to another peer or adult
Adult and student discuss the difficulty or problem
Adult and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and another person(s) joins the discussion
Adult recites all steps of the solution
Adult recites all steps of the solution, and another person(s) joins
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and no discussions are occurring
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, no discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, and discussions are occurring
Adult physically shows by taking over the student's computer, discussions are occurring, and another person (s) joins
Adult and student discuss the difficulty or problem, and then Adult directs student to another peer or adult
Peer directs student to talk to another peer or adult
Peer clearly states that he or she does not know how to help
Peer clearly states that he or she does not want to help
Adult directs student to talk to another peer or adult
Adult clearly states that he or she does not know how to help
Adult is unwilling to help
Adult verbally comments on student's work
Student dismisses his or her attempt for interacting (e.g. student does not call the person again) [end path]
Peer dismisses his or her attempt for interacting (e.g. peer does not call the student again) [end path]
Adult dismisses his or her attempt for interacting (e.g. adult does not call the student again) [end path]
Student ignored or cannot hear or code student's response to peer
Student ignored or cannot hear or code student's response to adult
Peer ignored or cannot hear or code peer's response to student
Adult ignored or cannot hear or code adult's response to student
Can't code interaction [end path]
Student and peer discuss a difficulty or problem
Student and peer discuss a difficulty or problem, and another person(s) joins the discussion
Student recites all steps of the solution
Student recites all steps of the solution, and another person(s) joins
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, and no discussions are occurring
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, no discussions are occurring, and another person(s) joins
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, and discussions are occurring
Student physically shows by taking over the peer's computer, discussions are occurring, and another person (s) joins
Student and peer discuss a difficulty or problem, and then student directs peer to another peer or adult
Student directs peer to talk to another peer or adult
Student clearly states that he or she does not know how to help
Student clearly states that he or she does not want to help
Student's cursor stopped moving for more than 30 seconds, or the student leaves station (> 30 seconds) and returns to independently work [end path]
Interaction terminates [end path]

branch_group_names: Peer - Unable or Unwilling to Help
Adult - Unable or Unwilling to Help
Student - Unable or Unwilling to Help

nodes.title: Was the problem solved or not solved? (Was the difficulty solved?)

branches.description: Problem was not solved
Problem was solved

nodes.title: What is the nature of the student's computing-related communication with the peer or adult?

branches.description: Student questions peer about something associated with peer's work
Student verbally comments about his/her own work, e.g. accomplishment
Student verbally comments about something associated with peer's work
Student expresses dissatisfaction or frustration
Student said something that is unclear or inaudible
Peer questions student about something associated with student's work
Peer verbally comments about something associated with his/her own work, e.g. accomplishment
Peer verbally comments about something associated with student's work
Peer expresses dissatisfaction or frustration
Peer said something that is unclear or inaudible

nodes.title: What is the student/peer/adult's response to the initial computing-related communication?

branches.description: Peer verbally responds to the student's curiosity, excitement, or frustration
Adult verbally responds to the student's curiosity, excitement, or frustration
Interaction terminates [end path]
Student/peer/adult ignored or cannot hear or code the response
Student/peer/adult said something that is unclear or inaudible
Student verbally responds to the peer's curiosity, excitement, or frustration
Student offers support to peer (the peer did not specifically ask for help)

nodes.title: How did the student/peer respond to the non-computing conversation?

branches.description: Peer verbally responds to student's non-computing conversation
Adult verbally responds to student's non-computing conversation
Interaction terminates [end path]
Student/peer/adult ignored or cannot hear or code response
Peer or adult redirects student to the computing task
Student/peer/adult said something that is unclear or inaudible
Student verbally responds to peer's non-computing conversation
Student redirects peer to the computing task

nodes.title: How does the event end or continue? (Independent Path)

branches.description: Student's cursor stopped moving for more than 30 seconds, or the student leaves station (> 30 seconds) and returns to independently work [end path]
branches.aside: Timestamp this code at the point where the student leaves the station or the student's cursor stops moving. Begin the next path at the point where the student returns to their station or the cursor begins moving.

branches.description: The video record ends [end path]
Student solves a problem previously discussed during an interaction [end path]
Interaction begins [end path]
branches.aside: Timestamp this code when the interaction begins. Create a new path for the interaction and start it

branches.description: Student switches to a computing related task while working independently [self loop]
Student switches to a non computing task while working independently [self loop]
